subject: For each zone log sensor name with max setpoint
commitMessage:
For each zone log sensor name with max setpoint

Add sensor name that has the maximum setpoint for a PID zone.
Log a debug message when the sensor is changed.
The name is also added to the log file for each log record.

Tested:
Override one CPU temperature sensor
busctl set-property xyz.openbmc_project.CPUSensor /xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/temperature/DTS_CPU1 xyz.openbmc_project.Sensor.Value Value d 82
Observed log message:
swampd[443]: PID Zone 0 max SetPoint 34.5546 requested by DTS_CPU1

Signed-off-by: Nirav Shah <nirav.j2.shah@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Zhikui Ren <zhikui.ren@intel.com>
Change-Id: Ifc12cb9a106da1bf41dd35697210f74ba1b589db

This seems like a fairly heavyweight addition, but it provides useful debugging text.

Agreed, it touches more code than anticipated. We had discussions internally. This approach was chosen because, logic wise, it is straight forward. The goal is to know which input is driving the fans. If there are other simpler approaches, please advise.
Good to know it was discussed about. I think it does actually require this much code, because you have to pass the extra information around a lot of different layers.
Please also add a column to the header, in initializeLog() above. Otherwise, the header columns will not line up with the data columns.
Please also check the "OpenBMC CI" comments. The tests are failing to compile. You can see the results at the Jenkins URL, hit "Console Output" to see the log.
Please remove the extra comma from the end of this line. Otherwise, it will make double commas.
Nice, it looks good to me now. Will wait a little, to see if anybody else has any other comments, before giving it +2.
extra return. Will remove with new patch
Josh has a better handle on this than I do, and is fully capable of reviewing this;  Removing myself from the reviewers list.
LGTM - good to have this, it's a handy feature for debugging a thermal zone
Thanks for the ping, hadn't seen this.
Giving +2 since it has been a while and no objection received
Oops, it looks like there has been some sdbusplus bit rot over time....
Addressed all comments and build passed. @Josh ready for your blessing again.
Fixed build issue, ready for review again.
Looks good to me, thanks for working on this
No objections received, it's been a while, looks like we're good
